revised_title: Hydrogen Atom Dispersion in a Flowing Gas: A Theoretical Study
tldr: The authors studied the dispersion of reactive species, specifically atomic hydrogen, in a flowing gas. They developed a theoretical model that takes into account irreversible loss of the reactive species by reaction on the tube wall and their reversible adsorption and desorption at the wall. The model shows that the longitudinal distribution of the reactive species becomes Gaussian eventually, and the dispersion of the reactive species increases linearly with time.
